Name: Statue of the Good Shepherd
Description: The statue portrays the Good Shepherd as a young man standing on a plinth, a square block serving as a base. He is clad in a short-sleeve chiton, which is a Greek garment reaching above his knees, with a belt around his waist. He carries a lamb on his shoulders, holding the lamb's legs with his right hand close to his chest. In his left hand, he holds a stick. Two small lambs stand next to his legs and look up to him. The statue is supported by a back pillar that ends in a plant decoration.
